body_html: Thanks. But I'm afraid that if we don't set the train flag to False even in during validation, we can't get appropriate results since BatchNormalization and Dropout behave differently in train/validation phase.
body_text: Thanks. But I'm afraid that if we don't set the train flag to False even in during validation, we can't get appropriate results since BatchNormalization and Dropout behave differently in train/validation phase.
body: Thanks. But I'm afraid that if we don't set the train flag to False even in during validation, we can't get appropriate results since BatchNormalization and Dropout behave differently in train/validation phase.
